intro: Lacinaria spicata, commonly known as the spiky lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels. Lacinaria spicata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shady areas. Its unique foliage and delicate flowers make it an ornamental plant in some horticultural settings.
